channel.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
channel.description:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,501068.60.html
Nobody made a reply to that topic for almost a month, so i thought i would re-start it. read the very last comment i made.

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @Entropy Entropy
item.description:
@Entropy wrote:

OKAY PHEW :). I got it working finally!. Only one problem now…When the Canvas is recreated (Because it is recreated at a semi-regular rate), the events don’t go through… :(. Whats the problem (The MouseEvent’s go through, but the KeyEvent’s don’t)?

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can see how SMART blocks events:

GitHub

BenLand100/SMART

SMART Minimizing Autoing Resource Thing --- A tool to run the RuneScape Client in a sandbox

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Entropy, post:19, topic:411514”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=512771.msg3734706#msg3734706 date=1314854084]

Okay, a few problem
When MY MOUSE is in the applet, (i’m debugging with System.out’s) it shows my mouses position, and not the virtual mouse. Also, the moment the Canvas re-creates, the System.out’s that show the mouse position switch suddently to “null”.

you have to attach the event listener to the new canvas.
[/quote]

myNewCanvas.addEventListener (new MouseMotionListener()…)
What do i do next?[/quote]

can’t just create a new mouse listener, you old one is still reporting in your system.out.println carry your old over to the new canvas.

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

To filter out events I advise hijacking the VM-local AWT event queue. You can push a copy of your own which ignores real events via EventQueue.push().

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.description:
@Entropy wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:18, topic:411514”][quote author=Entropy link=topic=512771.msg3731122#msg3731122 date=1314636508]
Okay, a few problem
When MY MOUSE is in the applet, (i’m debugging with System.out’s) it shows my mouses position, and not the virtual mouse. Also, the moment the Canvas re-creates, the System.out’s that show the mouse position switch suddently to “null”.
[/quote]
you have to attach the event listener to the new canvas.[/quote]

myNewCanvas.addEventListener (new MouseMotionListener()…)
What do i do next?

@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Entropy, post:16, topic:411514”]Okay, a few problem
When MY MOUSE is in the applet, (i’m debugging with System.out’s) it shows my mouses position, and not the virtual mouse. Also, the moment the Canvas re-creates, the System.out’s that show the mouse position switch suddently to “null”.[/quote]
you have to attach the event listener to the new canvas.

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I believe that is right, this code worked last time I tried it:

http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/src/com/cherokee/rs/rs2/RS2AccessorMethods.java?revision=33&view=markup

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @Entropy Entropy
item.description:
@Entropy wrote:

looking at the code though, it runs:

Component c = ac.getKeyListeners();

Im kind of confused about that method…It should return KeyListeners, but it returns a component? So what should i put there? My Canvas?

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Entropy:

Yeah but Cherokee uses special Cherokee based classes (like AccessorMethods). I do notice it uses FocusEvents…could i use that first before i dispatch normal events?

AccessorMethods just return normal things, like the canvas etc. It could be easily adapted to anything else.

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @Entropy Entropy
item.description:
@Entropy wrote:

Exactly 

public void pressKey(char c)
    {
            int code = (int)c;
            bot.getCanvas().dispatchEvent(new KeyEvent(bot.getCanvas(), KeyEvent.KEY_PRESSED, System.currentTimeMillis(), 0, code, c, KeyEvent.KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD));
            bot.getCanvas().dispatchEvent(new KeyEvent(bot.getCanvas(), KeyEvent.KEY_RELEASED, System.currentTimeMillis() + sleep, 0, code, c, KeyEvent.KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD));
    }

But when i use that method, nothing gets typed in…):

Read full topic
item.source: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas

item.title: Dispatching KeyEvents and MouseEvents to the Applet/Canvas
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

[quote=“Entropy, post:8, topic:411514”]Oh i fixed it! =). Turns out that was an internal error =0
But now, supposing that the getter for the Canvas is bot.getCanvas(), how do i send MouseEvents and KeyEvents to it? Thanks! =D[/quote]
http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/awt/Component.html#dispatchEvent(java.awt.AWTEvent)

Read full topic
